text: Your army has spotted something in the surrounding area that may have been of interest to you, but you were marching too fast to have time to see what it was. Switch to default stance before returning to the location to take a closer look.
We have passed by a smithy while fast travelling. Perharps we should see what it holds?
The master blacksmith cannot receive us right now. He is preparing the next set of equipments for the benefit of our kingdoms. He will warn us when he is finished.
The Master Blacksmith Is Ready To Receive You
The master blacksmith sends his regards. He says to send a lord so he can choose from a set of masterpieces for our lord when possible. It would be ideal to attend to your suggestion.

We have occupied this abandoned blacksmith shop that has ample capacity, tools and structures that allow creations of excellent quality. A new master smith of our kingdom has been assigned to produce with the artisans under his command and defend the smithy with the detachment that we have assigned to him. May it produce the best for the kingdom.

We have visited a smithy belonging to a neighboring kingdom. The master blacksmith speaks to us from the walls of the building and tells us news about the kingdom to which he belongs, but he never lets us in. Only through war or the destruction of its owning faction can we take control of the smithy and appoint a new blacksmith to our kingdom. Maybe we should take it?

You have given a large sum of capital to the master blacksmith to improve the smithy and increased his garrison to protect it. Artisans rejoice and celebrate: lots of new tools and increased work area will allow them to get richer, keep more craftsmen and create equipment of even better quality. They also promise to increase the frequency of their tributes. All for the good of the kingdom!\\n

You have sent the master blacksmith and the garrison an urgent message to retreat. They have obeyed you. The enemies have taken control of the smithy but you have allowed your people to live another day. We'll get the smithy back in time.

The enemy army routed, their master blacksmith killed with most of his disciples. We occupy the well equipped smithy with our own master blacksmith and assign a detachment of soldiers to protect him and his disciples. They will start sending tributes whenever they can. We can also visit them for special gifts from time to time. Everything for the good of the kingdom!
Surprisingly the hammers have been stronger than our army weapons.  We really should take  the smithy after having been routed by it. It is a testament of its importance for our kingdom.

Blacksmith hammers along with more conventional weapons are filled with blood on the plain. The enemy is scared of both tools and weapons. They run without looking towards the smithy, that stands tall like a lord's castle overlooking it's domain. We have won to create another day!

We lost control of the smithy. We were able to save the master blacksmith and part of his disciples, but we were unable to maintain control of the smithy, losing both the tribute and the opportunity to make official visits. As soon as we can recapture it we should do it.
